intro: Bonaga arvensis, commonly known as the field bonaga, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Bonaga arvensis is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in agricultural fields.
